action-group.diy-instructions:
Very important: Please do not install if you haven't even read about how phpBB mods are. OAuth-based plugins are reliant on the url you use so you can't test this on a localhost. A Facebook app that ties with such a mod like this requires you to indicate on which url the Facebook app will communicate.
1. Important: Run the sql that came with the instructions. 2. We currently have Facebook support. So create a facebook app, you need the following: App ID and App secret. 3. No ACP module at the moment, so after installation and running sql, just go to the forum/oauthorize.php file and look at the top portion where you can place these values. 4. Create a Custom Profile Field. Follow cautiously.
Edit profile field Field type: Single text field Field identification: oauth_facebook_id //follow this format Publicly display profile field: Yes Display on registration screen: Ticked (Necessary for the registration to work since the template uses javascript to automatically input the obtained Facebook ID. PS. The field is also styled display:none) Display on viewtopic screen: Ticked Field name/title presented to the user: Facebook ID Field description: This ID is being used for OAuth so that the forum can identify which tokens are valid. Set it to 0 as Default
Profile type specific options Length of input box: 30 Minimum number of characters: 0 Maximum number of characters: 30 Field validation: Only numbers
Additional information you may like to know : Since we are using Custom profile fields to install Facebook IDs, you can easily use it in templates like viewtopic_body.html to present any info made publicly available through the Open Graph.
e.g. Creating Facebook link in viewtopic_body
Go again to oauth_facebook_id Custom Profile Field in ACP, make sure 'Hide Profile Field is unchecked'. This will make sure that regular users are not able to edit it in their UCP.
Go to ACP > General > Load Settings,
Display custom profile fields in user profiles: NO (Some would set this to YES but when you do so, most likely you have to edit the template so that you can make better use of Facebook ID instead of just displaying mere numbers.)
5. Purge cache
Roadmap: 1. Adding more OAuth providers as they are basically the same but with minor difference in implementations. 2. ACP although better if someone else will contribute this. 3. Take advantage of the fact that we're storing the provider IDs like Facebook ID as custom profile fields.
If you need help, try the phpBB forum or go to the facebook page that is indicated in this file.
